title: "How can daily contemplation and symbol tracing enhance consciousness and energy?"
first_phrase: In this text, the author reflects on the importance of embracing the light within ourselves and using it to become more conscious and active individuals. The sense of this non-physical, invisible light must be embodied by saying "THE LIGHT IS IN ME". The author emphasizes the need for these contemplations to become alive and lead to a subtle sensitivity to the rhythm of day and night. The purpose is best achieved when discipline becomes integrated into everyday life. The last 200 tokens introduce the idea of Chain Instructions, including exercises that involve tracing symbols around oneself and feeling like the center of them. These exercises aim to increase one's awareness of the level of light in their consciousness and energy.
content: Non vi è chi non abbia nella giornata, per occupata che sia, dei momenti di pausa, nei quali egli però si abban dona ad un pensare a caso o guidato dalle sue preoc cupazioni. In que sti tracciamenti è bene distinguere tre atti: 1. Un momento di raccoglimento, in cui ci si ponga e senta quale centro della figura; poi, come se questo centro liberasse da sé e proiettasse un altro punto, ester no a noi. 1. Imagine di questo punto che si sposta e che va a tracciare la figura. 2. Fissare la figura descritta nel suo insieme, poi abbandonarla e tornare a sentirsi al centro e come centro.
last_phrase: Take advantage of the little moments of pause during the day to connect with your higher consciousness. You can do this by focusing on the present moment, and by practicing the mental exercise of tracing the main symbols of the Chain. By putting these techniques into practice, you will gradually increase the level of light in your consciousness and energy.
